database package#

Submodules#

database.database_commands module#

This module contains all functions with logic to interact with the database finances.db. This is the only module which accesses the database. There are six tables; expenses, income, categories, sources, budget and goals.

database.database_commands.connect_db()[source]#

Establishes a connection to the SQLite database and returns the connection and cursor.

Returns:

connection and cursor

database.database_commands.create_and_populate_tables()[source]#

This function creates all tables in the database if they don’t exist. If it is the first time they have been created, then it populates the table with dummy data.

Returns:

None

database.database_commands.enter_budget(cat_id, amount, term)[source]#

This function enters a new budget assigned to a category

Parameters:

  • cat_id – primary key in categories table

  • amount – new budget amount

  • term – “weekly”, “monthly”, or “annual”

Returns:

None

database.database_commands.enter_category(new_cat, table)[source]#

This function enters a new category in a table

Parameters:

  • new_cat – new expense category or income source

  • table – expenses or sources table in database

Returns:

None

database.database_commands.enter_expense(expense_tuple)[source]#

This function enters an expense into the expenses table.

Parameters:

expense_tuple – tuple with date, expense, amount, categoryID

Returns:

None

database.database_commands.enter_goal(goal, amount, term)[source]#

This function enters a new goal into the goals table

Parameters:

  • goal – ‘budget’, ‘net income’ or ‘gross income’

  • amount – amount of money in goal

  • term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’ or ‘annual’

Returns:

None

database.database_commands.enter_income(income_tuple)[source]#

This function enters an income into the income table.

Parameters:

income_tuple – tuple with date, source, amount

Returns:

None

database.database_commands.get_category_from_budget(budget_id)[source]#

This function gets the category description, for a budget set by category, from its budget id number

Parameters:

budget_id – budget primary key, category foreign key

Returns:

category description or None

Return type:

str or None

database.database_commands.get_category_from_id(category_id, table)[source]#

This function gets the description of an expenses category or income source from its id number

Parameters:

  • category_id – primary key in table

  • table – ‘categories’ or ‘sources’

Returns:

category

Return type:

str

database.database_commands.get_expenses_by_date(days_list)[source]#

This function gets expenses for each day in a list

Parameters:

days_list – list of days

Returns:

list of rows from expenses table

Return type:

list of tuples

database.database_commands.get_expenses_date_amount(cat_id)[source]#

This function gets the date and amount of expenses from a chosen category

Parameters:

cat_id – foreign key in expenses table, primary in categories

Returns:

date and amount of expenses

Return type:

list of tuples

database.database_commands.get_goal(goal, term)[source]#

This function gets a goal amount from the goals table from its description and term

Parameters:

  • goal – ‘budget’, ‘net income’ or ‘gross income’

  • term – ‘weekly’, ‘monthly’ or ‘annual’

Returns:

goal amount or None

Return type:

float or None

database.database_commands.get_income_by_date(days_list)[source]#

This function gets income for each day in a list

Parameters:

days_list – list of days

Returns:

list of rows from income table

Return type:

list of tuples

database.database_commands.get_joined_rows(table)[source]#

This function gets all rows from a joined table.

Parameters:

table – table name

Returns:

all rows from table

Return type:

list of tuples

database.database_commands.get_max_budget_id()[source]#

This function gets the maximum value for primary key in budget table

Returns:

max_id

Return type:

int

database.database_commands.get_row_list(table)[source]#

This function gets a list of all the rows in a table

Parameters:

table – table in database

Returns:

all rows

Return type:

list

database.database_commands.get_rows(year_month, table)[source]#

This function gets all rows from a table, appends all rows to a list where the date they were entered matches a selected month.

Parameters:

year_month – YYYY-MM

Returns:

all rows which match year_month from table

Return type:

list of tuples

database.database_commands.update_category(table, cat_id, update)[source]#

This function updates a description for an expense category or an income source

Parameters:

  • table – ‘categories’ or ‘sources’

  • cat_id – primary key id number

Returns:

None

database.populate_finances_db module#

This module adds dummy data to the tables in finances.db database for testing purposes.

database.populate_finances_db.enter_budgets_goals()[source]#

This function enters goals and budgets dummy data into tables in database

Returns:

None

database.populate_finances_db.populate_tables()[source]#

This function populates tables in database with dummy data

Returns:

None
